summary: An introductory email from an FBI Special Agent to a potential witness, arranging an interview for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email outlines the investigative team and their focus on child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the FBI's investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the FBI's investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Author of the email, identifies as a case agent assigned to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation working out of the New York Field Office on child exploitation and human trafficking matters.

persons.name: Detective Constable
persons.context: Copied on the email; previously in contact with the recipient.

persons.name: Detective M
persons.context: Partner of the FBI Special Agent, member of the child exploitation/human trafficking task force.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same FBI investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking.
The FBI Special Agent is a case agent assigned to the investigation into Epstein.
The FBI Special Agent is a case agent assigned to the investigation into Maxwell.
Work alongside each other as partners on the child exploitation/human trafficking task force investigating Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: FBI Introductory Email Sent
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends an introductory email to a potential witness to arrange an interview for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Planned Witness Interview
events.description: The FBI proposes conducting a video conference interview with the recipient around the first week of March 2021.

keyFacts: The FBI is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for child exploitation and human trafficking as of February 2021.
The investigative team includes an FBI Special Agent, an NYPD Detective (Detective M), and three Assistant United States Attorneys.
The FBI is reaching out to potential witnesses to conduct interviews as part of a thorough investigation.
The communication indicates ongoing law enforcement efforts related to the Epstein case after his death.
